titleStmt.title: Description of Free Library of Philadelphia Lewis O 90: Tuḥfah-ʼi Shāhidī.

licence.#text: These images and the content of Rare Book Department Lewis O 90: Tuḥfah-ʼi Shāhidī. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

This work is published from: United States. For a summary of CC0, see https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. Legal code: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/legalcode.

note: Catalog entry, number 354, pasted in (first front flyleaf verso). The typewritten number 1842 pasted in upside down (first front flyleaf verso).

msContents.summary: Neatly written copy of a Persian-Ottoman Turkish vocabulary in verse.

persName.#text: Shāhidī Dadah Mughlavī, Ibrāhīm ibn Ṣāliḥ, 1470 or 1471-1550 or 1551
شاهدى دده مغلوى، ابراهيم بن صالح،

name.#text: Free Library of Philadelphia. Rare Book Department. John Frederick Lewis Collection of Oriental Manuscripts

supportDesc.extent: i, 68, ii leaves : 192 x 124 (120 x 67) mm bound to 191 x 132 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation added in pencil, upper left recto; catchwords every verso, lower left.

layoutDesc.layout: Seven lines in three columns with up to 50 lines at angles (in two sets of up to 25) in the three margins along the outside edges; margins ruled in drypoint.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in naskh in black ink; pointed, main text vocalized.

decoNote: Illuminated headpiece in gold with purple, blue, and yellow flowers and green leaves and stems with purple and red borders and red and blue finials along the top (f. 1v); textblock border-ruled in double gold and red; columns ruled in double gold; page-opening ruled in narrow gold; rubrications in red.

binding.p: Bound in green leather over pasteboard which has been cut for an inlay mandorla and two pendants on the vertical axis so that faint impressions are visible under the leather, with flap (Type II); gilt-stamped frame; doublure of marbled paper in brown, blue and pink with yellow paper endleaves sprinkled in silver. Manuscript comes with a red leather carrying case, with marbled paper interior and the same gilt-stamped frame as the codex, a red textile pull with a gilt-stamped leather tab, partially deteriorated, connects to the inside.

origin.p: The item was copied by Muḥ̣ammad Amīn in 1216 A.H. (1801 or 1802 CE) (f. 68r).

history.provenance: Formerly owned by John Frederick Lewis (bookplate, first front flyleaf verso).

surface.@n: Inside back cover flap open to show design
Back cover flap opened to show design
Fore edge flap closed, inside front cover
